"""Tests for ceilometer.meter """ from ceilometer.collector import meter from ceilometer import counter from ceilometer.openstack.common import jsonutils def test_compute_signature_change_key(): sig1 = meter.compute_signature({'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'}, 'not-so-secret') sig2 = meter.compute_signature({'A': 'A', 'b': 'B'}, 'not-so-secret') assert sig1 != sig2 def test_compute_signature_change_value(): sig1 = meter.compute_signature({'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'}, 'not-so-secret') sig2 = meter.compute_signature({'a': 'a', 'b': 'B'}, 'not-so-secret') assert sig1 != sig2 def test_compute_signature_same(): sig1 = meter.compute_signature({'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'}, 'not-so-secret') sig2 = meter.compute_signature({'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'}, 'not-so-secret') assert sig1 == sig2 def test_compute_signature_signed(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'} sig1 = meter.compute_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') data['message_signature'] = sig1 sig2 = meter.compute_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') assert sig1 == sig2 def test_compute_signature_use_configured_secret(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'} sig1 = meter.compute_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') sig2 = meter.compute_signature(data, 'different-value') assert sig1 != sig2 def test_verify_signature_signed(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'} sig1 = meter.compute_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') data['message_signature'] = sig1 assert meter.verify_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') def test_verify_signature_unsigned(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B'} assert not meter.verify_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') def test_verify_signature_incorrect(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', 'message_signature': 'Not the same'} assert not meter.verify_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') def test_recursive_keypairs(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', 'nested': {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', }, } pairs = list(meter.recursive_keypairs(data)) assert pairs == [('a', 'A'), ('b', 'B'), ('nested:a', 'A'), ('nested:b', 'B'), ] def test_verify_signature_nested(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', 'nested': {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', }, } data['message_signature'] = meter.compute_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') assert meter.verify_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') def test_verify_signature_nested_json(): data = {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', 'nested': {'a': 'A', 'b': 'B', 'c': ('c',), 'd': ['d'] }, } data['message_signature'] = meter.compute_signature(data, 'not-so-secret') jsondata = jsonutils.loads(jsonutils.dumps(data)) assert meter.verify_signature(jsondata, 'not-so-secret') TEST_COUNTER = counter.Counter(name='name', type='typ', unit='', volume=1, user_id='user', project_id='project', resource_id=2, timestamp='today', resource_metadata={'key': 'value'}, ) TEST_NOTICE = { u'_context_auth_token': u'3d8b13de1b7d499587dfc69b77dc09c2', u'_context_is_admin': True, u'_context_project_id': u'7c150a59fe714e6f9263774af9688f0e', u'_context_quota_class': None, u'_context_read_deleted': u'no', u'_context_remote_address': u'10.0.2.15', u'_context_request_id': u'req-d68b36e0-9233-467f-9afb-d81435d64d66', u'_context_roles': [u'admin'], u'_context_timestamp': u'2012-05-08T20:23:41.425105', u'_context_user_id': u'1e3ce043029547f1a61c1996d1a531a2', u'event_type': u'compute.instance.create.end', u'message_id': u'dae6f69c-00e0-41c0-b371-41ec3b7f4451', u'payload': {u'created_at': u'2012-05-08 20:23:41', u'deleted_at': u'', u'disk_gb': 0, u'display_name': u'testme', u'fixed_ips': [{u'address': u'10.0.0.2', u'floating_ips': [], u'meta': {}, u'type': u'fixed', u'version': 4}], u'image_ref_url': u'http://10.0.2.15:9292/images/UUID', u'instance_id': u'9f9d01b9-4a58-4271-9e27-398b21ab20d1', u'instance_type': u'm1.tiny', u'instance_type_id': 2, u'launched_at': u'2012-05-08 20:23:47.985999', u'memory_mb': 512, u'state': u'active', u'state_description': u'', u'tenant_id': u'7c150a59fe714e6f9263774af9688f0e', u'user_id': u'1e3ce043029547f1a61c1996d1a531a2'}, u'priority': u'INFO', u'publisher_id': u'compute.vagrant-precise', u'timestamp': u'2012-05-08 20:23:48.028195', } def test_meter_message_from_counter_signed(): msg = meter.meter_message_from_counter(TEST_COUNTER, 'not-so-secret', 'src') assert 'message_signature' in msg def test_meter_message_from_counter_field(): def compare(f, c, msg_f, msg): assert msg == c msg = meter.meter_message_from_counter(TEST_COUNTER, 'not-so-secret', 'src') name_map = {'name': 'counter_name', 'type': 'counter_type', 'unit': 'counter_unit', 'volume': 'counter_volume', } for f in TEST_COUNTER._fields: msg_f = name_map.get(f, f) yield compare, f, getattr(TEST_COUNTER, f), commit_message:
Adds --addn-hosts to the dnsmasq arg list

When using multi_host=True and update_dns_entries=True, dns records from
other compute hosts were not able to be resolved.  The --addn-host arg was
constructed but not appended to the cmd list.

Change-Id: I9cafb59256e92bdad0df3e9166e0afd079ae0c09
Fixes: bug #1170529
(cherry picked from commit 3922da72b2569976f25183c476cedcc17d32fa13)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/87/28187/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: '--addn-hosts=%s' % _dhcp_file(dev, 'hosts')

commit_message:
Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11
(cherry picked from commit f48a2e1a68cca1ef147279b2ddf713635f494bc0)

commit_message:
Adds instance root disk size checks during resize

Fixes bug: #1163844

The Hyper-V driver does not support disk resizes to a smaller size.
This patch verifies the disk size compatibility before the migration
starts in order to avoid data losses.

Change-Id: Ie99bf8779d583e97b911c9a136cee1bca9a1ecdc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/54/28354/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_target_instance_type(self, instance, instance_type): new_root_gb = instance_type['root_gb'] curr_root_gb = instance['root_gb'] if new_root_gb < curr_root_gb: raise vmutils.HyperVException(_("Cannot resize the root disk to a " "smaller size. Current size: " "%(curr_root_gb)s GB. Requested " "size: %(new_root_gb)s GB") % locals()) self._check_target_instance_type(instance, instance_type)

commit_message:
Use updated metadata location for nova.baremetal.arch.

boot-stack was looking for a config value in the metadata
at 'nova.bm_arch', but it was recently moved to 'nova.baremetal.arch'.

added_lines: params = { 'limit': context['query_string'].get('limit'), 'marker': context['query_string'].get('marker'), } return self._format_user_list(user_list, **params) def _format_user_list(self, user_list, **kwargs): marker = kwargs.get('marker') first_index = 0 if marker is not None: for (marker_index, user) in enumerate(user_list): if user['id'] == marker: # we start pagination after the marker first_index = marker + 1 break else: msg = 'Marker could not be found' raise exception.ValidationError(message=msg) limit = kwargs.get('limit') last_index = None if limit is not None: try: limit = int('limit') if limit < 0: raise AssertionError() except (ValueError, AssertionError): msg = 'Invalid limit value' raise exception.ValidationError(message=msg) last_index = first_index + limit user_list = user_list[first_index:last_index] return user_list
deleted_lines: return {'users': user_list}

commit_message:
Use webtest for tests and reorganise.

Replace starting an eventlet server for every API call with webtest
requests. The intention for the moment is not to increase speed but to
limit the dependency of our tests on eventlet. Currently the client/ and
server/ tests are the only ones running against an active server.

Group related API tests into modules.

The naming structure I've tried for is:
    tests/{name}/ - A group of related tests for a component.
    tests/{name}/base_{name}.py - Common functionality for tests.
    tests/{name}/{str}_tests.py - A group of tests related to {str} that
        aren't runnable but should be included in specific backend test cases.
    tests/{name}/test_{str}.py - A set of runnable test cases for target {str}.

In writing tests the primary change for API tests is that the
response.body is now the string body and response.result is the parsed
dictionary. This is a restriction of webob/webtest.

Change-Id: I059ddf2a26fd5f072ced70faf516185b8e51184c

commit_message:
Retry losetup -d for up to 10 seconds.

When partition tables are added to loopback devices, this can set off a
chain of udev hooks that may still be holding the loopback open. Failing
to detach loopback devices was the reason we were seeing leaked tmpfs
volumes.

Fixes bug #1178091

Change-Id: I836d6e2bbce824951dd4786e3ef28273ea18ee73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/87/28687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: syntax=sh ts=4 sts=4 sw=2:etfunction detach_loopback() { local loopdev=$1 # loopback dev may be tied up a bit by udev events triggered by partition events for try in $(seq 10 -1 1) ; do if sudo losetup -d $loopdev ; then return 0 fi echo $loopdev may be busy, sleeping up to $try more seconds... sleep 1 done echo Gave up trying to detach $loopdev return 1 }

subject: Enable live block migration when using iSCSI volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-03-26 17:53:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b76921a5d390a7615466591f0fc02d404feafd4d', 'message': 'DO NOT MERGE

Draft fix for bug 1160323.

Depends on internal XAPI commit 11de810d740cc08946e90752e86728a6e98574eb
with commit message CP-4498: Added relaxed check mode to allow
iSCSI SRs during XSM.

It also depends on a configuration change which must be documented and added to devstack:
* Set "relax-xsm-sr-check = true" in /etc/xapi.conf

This commit makes the following changes:
* Attach the SR on the destination host prior to migrate

commit_message:
Enable live block migration when using iSCSI volumes

Fix for bug 1160323.

DocImpact
Depends on a version of XAPI supporting relax-xsm-sr-check.
Currently no release versions support this, so the change at
https://github.com/xen-org/xen-api/pull/1116 would need to be applied
to the source to enable this.  XenServer 6.2 is expected to
support this mode, and possibly some future hotfixes for XenServer 6.1.

It also depends on a configuration change which must be documented and added to devstack:
* Set "relax-xsm-sr-check = true" in /etc/xapi.conf

This commit makes the following changes:
* Attach the SR on the destination host prior to migrate
* Returns the SR-ref from the pre_migrate call (API change)
* Populates the XS VDI map with the sr-ref on the destination host
* Removes the connection to the SR from the source host post-migrate
* Added plugin to determine if iSCSI block migration is enabled

Associated tempest test at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26478/

Change-Id: I917d9cf094190d636f4b9e14f6c8e728ff85af0e
Fixes: bug 1160323
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/25419/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pre_live_migration_data = self.driver.pre_live_migration(context, instance, return pre_live_migration_data pre_migration_data = self.compute_rpcapi.pre_live_migration( context, instance, block_migration, disk, dest, migrate_data) migrate_data['pre_migration_data'] = pre_migration_data # Detach from the hypervisor and terminate the connection self.driver.detach_volume(jsonutils.loads(bdm['connection_info']), None, None)
deleted_lines: self.driver.pre_live_migration(context, instance, self.compute_rpcapi.pre_live_migration(context, instance, block_migration, disk, dest, migrate_data) # remove the volume connection without detaching from hypervisor # because the instance is not running anymore on the current host

commit_message:
Allow empty configuration value

Some Nova configurations allows an empty value. In some case,
an empty string needs to be explicitly set otherwise
the default value is used. (such as dhcp_domain)

Change-Id: I410f981ec6976f9bb4e5877cc14730d17ff4225b

commit_message:
Rename nova_config rspec tests

The unit tests got updated when we changed nova_config provider
from parsed to ini_settings, but we forgot to rename the file.
Renaming it to better reflect which provider is tested.

Change-Id: Ib3c0581b589e01db804ffba54c7faf7f329ce844

commit_message:
Fixes KeyError bug with network api associate

Fixes bug in network api associate function where it would always
raise a KeyError when associating or disassociating a project.

Fixes bug 1171284

Change-Id: Iae0e57e0a961b8a3377b38dad72094188755a3e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/28497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_network_disassociate_project(self): def fake_network_disassociate(ctx, network_id, disassociate_host, disassociate_project): self.assertEqual(network_id, 1) self.assertEqual(disassociate_host, False) self.assertEqual(disassociate_project, True) def fake_get(context, network_uuid): return {'id': 1} self.stubs.Set(self.network_api.db, 'network_disassociate', fake_network_disassociate) self.stubs.Set(self.network_api, 'get', fake_get) self.network_api.associate(self.context, FAKE_UUID, project=None)

commit_message:
Add documentation for query parameters

Add documenation for 'marker', 'limit' and 'is_public' query
paramters.

Addresses bug 1177739.

Change-Id: I429ec7a54c132a6eee64846932ff72b35acfbfb2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/48/28548/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The `min_ram` field is an integer specifying the minimum amount of The `min_disk` field is an integer specifying the minimum amount ofThese two resources also accept additional query parameters:* ``marker=ID`` An image identifier marker may be specified. When present only images whose identifiers occur after ``ID`` will be listed. * ``limit=LIMIT`` When present the maximum number of results returned will not exceed ``LIMIT``. .. note:: If the specified ``LIMIT`` exceeds the operator defined limit (api_limit_max) then the number of results returned may be less than ``LIMIT``. * ``is_public=PUBLIC`` An admin user may use the `is_public` parameter to control which results are returned. When the `is_public` parameter is absent or set to `True` the following images will be listed: Images whose `is_public` field is `True`, owned images and shared images. When the `is_public` parameter is set to `False` the following images will be listed: Images (owned, shared, or non-owned) whose `is_public` field is `False`. When the `is_public` parameter is set to `None` all images will be listed irrespective of owner, shared status or the `is_public` field. .. note:: Use of the 'is_public' parameter is restricted to admin users. For all other users it will be ignored.
deleted_lines: The 'min_ram' field is an integer specifying the minimum amount of The 'min_disk' field is an integer specifying the minimum amount ofThese two resources also accept sort parameters:

commit_message:
Record smoketest dependency on gFlags

The smoketests currently have a dependency on gFlags. Long term, this should
be converted to use openstack.common.cfg; but in the near term, we should
record this existing dependency.

Fixes bug 1174953

Change-Id: I465abc6a4a2e8f7ebd1fe70ad239c760960a82ed

commit_message:
Add pbr to devstack.

It's being used in all of the core projects, so we should install it
at the start so we can ensure that we don't break everything all at
once.

Change-Id: I326d724264803e88315ee9e40f4634836baf6e0b

commit_message:
Expand HACKING with commit message guidelines

Add a 'Commit Messages' section to HACKING describing how a commit
message should be formed.

Change-Id: Ife0d6eab18cc0f07ad8e8c79cb2e4198513236d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/89/27589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Commit Messages --------------- Using a common format for commit messages will help keep our git history readable. Follow these guidelines: First, provide a brief summary of 50 characters or less. Summaries of greater then 72 characters will be rejected by the gate. The first line of the commit message should provide an accurate description of the change, not just a reference to a bug or blueprint. It must be followed by a single blank line. Following your brief summary, provide a more detailed description of the patch, manually wrapping the text at 72 characters. This description should provide enough detail that one does not have to refer to external resources to determine its high-level functionality. Once you use 'git review', two lines will be appended to the commit message: a blank line followed by a 'Change-Id'. This is important to correlate this commit with a specific review in Gerrit, and it should not be modified. For further information on constructing high quality commit messages, and how to split up commits into a series of changes, consult the project wiki: http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages

commit_message:
Ensure default flavor is set when upgrading tempest

Add DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE to upgrade tempest to ensure this is
set. This avoids recreation of existing flavors when upgrading
tempest.

Change-Id: If2e872132939faa4b8afc8dc9b7d7d9aeb026c96
Fix: Bug 1178028
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/93/28693/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=${DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE:-m1.tiny}

commit_message:
Fix: kill screen on stop-base

The screen name can be different from 'stack' in grenade.
Change it to use the global variable.

Change-Id: I57d55b2713dec26140a94c28c4fd373f8989cef7
Blueprint: blueprint/nightly-upgrade-testing

deleted_lines: SESSION=$(screen -ls | awk '/[0-9].stack/ { print $1 }')

commit_message:
Fix setup-grenade to pass user and host as parameter

setup-grenade was not working when defining a different username/host
when running ./setup-grenade <host> [<user>].

commit_message:
Add an element to configure a serial console.

With ILO and other remote machine management cards, a serial console is
actually useful.

Change-Id: I86f74d9dae3821b4682df813c5b52a83a29a138a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/59/28659/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Start getty on ttyS0 or ttyS1 With ILO and other remote admin environments, having a serial console can be useful for debugging / troubleshooting. If ttyS1 exists, getty will run on that, otherwise on ttyS0.

commit_message:
Create a common function for method _parse_network_vlan_ranges used
by plugins.

The _parse_network_vlan_ranges method does the same thing for the
linuxbridge, ovs, and hyperv plugins. Create a common function for
the plugins to use instead. This paves the way for improving vlan
range verification (see #1169266) in one place.

Fixes Bug #1177428

Change-Id: Ie8c20807e9146dd9c8bc011dd3a4dc10ec871e0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/56/28656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from quantum.plugins.common import plugin_utils try: self.network_vlan_ranges = plugin_utils.parse_network_vlan_ranges( cfg.CONF.VLANS.network_vlan_ranges) except Exception as ex: LOG.error(_("%(error)s. Agent terminated!"), {'error': ex}) sys.exit(1) LOG.info(_("Network VLAN ranges: %s"), self.network_vlan_ranges)
deleted_lines: self.network_vlan_ranges = {} for entry in cfg.CONF.VLANS.network_vlan_ranges: if ':' in entry: try: physical_network, vlan_min, vlan_max = entry.split(':') self._add_network_vlan_range(physical_network, int(vlan_min), int(vlan_max)) except ValueError as ex: LOG.error(_("Invalid network VLAN range: " "'%(entry)s' - %(ex)s. " "Service terminated!"), {'entry': entry, 'ex': ex}) sys.exit(1) else: self._add_network(entry) LOG.debug(_("Network VLAN ranges: %s"), self.network_vlan_ranges) def _add_network_vlan_range(self, physical_network, vlan_min, vlan_max): self._add_network(physical_network) self.network_vlan_ranges[physical_network].append((vlan_min, vlan_max)) def _add_network(self, physical_network): if physical_network not in self.network_vlan_ranges: self.network_vlan_ranges[physical_network] = []

commit_message:
Fetch routers ports for metadata access from DB

Bug 1176963

There is no need to retrieve the ports from the NVP backend, so
a DB query will be enough.

Change-Id: If3529cc5694434e8cdc9d21a4043f94212146d2d

commit_message:
Improve checking of return values for functions in linuxbridge agent plugin

Fixes bug 1167780

Changed return values for some ensure_* functions to make them more consistent.
Now all ensure_* functions return None on failure and return the entity that was
created within the function when successful. Made changes to the unit tests to
reflect the changed return values.

Change-Id: Ib015ee7cee50bae5d91a4e109e7381519c1e14f7

commit_message:
Change type of cells.deleted from boolean to integer.

Fixes bug #1168490

Migration 152 changed other tables' deleted column from boolean
to integer, but cells got missed.  SQLite and MySQL are weakly-
typed enough that mixing integers and booleans is allowed, but
PostgreSQL is not, and this causes an error.

Migration 179 is a copy of migration 152, except applied only to
the cells table.

Change-Id: I85c39765edc206d38d21827ab54e1371155b9557
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/28567/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # migration 179 - convert cells.deleted from boolean to int def _pre_upgrade_179(self, engine): cells_data = [ {'id': 4, 'deleted': True}, ] cells = get_table(engine, 'cells') engine.execute(cells.insert(), cells_data) return dict(cells=cells_data) def _check_179(self, engine, data): cells = get_table(engine, 'cells') cell = cells.select(cells.c.id == 4).execute().first() self.assertEqual(4, cell.deleted)

commit_message:
Allow missing tags in templates.

Previously missing_tags was set to 'strict', so any missing values in
the configuration json would be flagged as an error. They will now be
ignored and returned as u'', per the pystache documentation.

Change-Id: I46d675bdd76948238191be92f0a2162963fcc478

This patch allows the ability for user password to be updated via a command prompt so the password doesnt show up in the bash history. The prompted password is asked twice to verify the match. If user cntl-D's the prompt a message appears suggesting user to use either of the options to update the password.

commit_message:
Allow secure user password update.

This patch allows the ability for user password to be updated via a command prompt so the password doesnt show up in the bash history. The prompted password is asked twice to verify the match. If user cntl-D's the prompt a message appears suggesting user to use either of the options to update the password.

Change-Id: I439604f9c858aa022607e22d32a24cc6b99d42dd
Fixes: bug#938315
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/86/28686/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('--pass', metavar='<password>', dest='passwd', required=False, # prompt user for password, so it doesnt appear in bash history new_passwd = args.passwd while new_passwd is None: try: passwd = getpass.getpass('New Password: ') rep_passwd = getpass.getpass('Repeat New Password: ') if passwd == rep_passwd: new_passwd = passwd else: print "Passwords don't match; retry" except EOFError: print "\nPlease specify password using the --pass option, "\ " or using the prompt" return kc.users.update_password(user, new_passwd)
deleted_lines: @utils.arg('--pass', metavar='<password>', dest='passwd', required=True, kc.users.update_password(user, args.passwd)

Change-Id: I8b1b2d8623a0626516342f7750eecb3087e8a880
'}]
commit_message:
Adds metadata_listen parameter

Previously, metadata_listen used the api_bind_address
parameter, but there are scenarios when it should listen on another
IP address, such as localhost - for example, when using Quantum
metadata.

Change-Id: I8b1b2d8623a0626516342f7750eecb3087e8a880
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/03/28703/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $metadata_listen = '0.0.0.0', 'DEFAULT/metadata_listen': value => $metadata_listen;
deleted_lines: 'DEFAULT/metadata_listen': value => $api_bind_address;

commit_message:
Securely create signing_dir (bug 1174608)

Also verifies the security of an existing signing_dir.

Change-Id: I0685b4274a94ad3974a2b2a7ab3f45830d3934bb
(cherry picked from python-keystoneclient 1736e2ffb12f70eeebed019448bc14def48aa036)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/77/28577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os.path.exists(self.signing_dirname): if not os.access(self.signing_dirname, os.W_OK): raise ConfigurationError( 'unable to access signing_dir %s' % self.signing_dirname) if os.stat(self.signing_dirname).st_uid != os.getuid(): self.LOG.warning( 'signing_dir is not owned by %s' % os.getlogin()) current_mode = stat.S_IMODE(os.stat(self.signing_dirname).st_mode) if current_mode != stat.S_IRWXU: self.LOG.warning( 'signing_dir mode is %s instead of %s' % (oct(current_mode), oct(stat.S_IRWXU))) else: os.makedirs(self.signing_dirname, stat.S_IRWXU)
deleted_lines: if (os.path.exists(self.signing_dirname) and not os.access(self.signing_dirname, os.W_OK)): raise ConfigurationError("unable to access signing dir %s" % self.signing_dirname) if not os.path.exists(self.signing_dirname): os.makedirs(self.signing_dirname) #will throw IOError if it cannot change permissions os.chmod(self.signing_dirname, stat.S_IRWXU)

commit_message:
Controller and API changes for backups.

-API controller for backups
-adding swift url to the config
-Fixing failing tests
-Renaming 'instance' param.
 Checking for NotFound models so that the returned error is friendly
-adding feature to list all backups from a specific instance
-Adding checks for creating/deleting/restoring backups when it is not completed
-Adding unit tests for backup controller
-adding check to see if file is in swift
-Adding skeleton code for delete backup in the task manager
-Fixed backups API to pass in the backup_id during create_backup.
-adding int tests for backup controller
-Adding backup list and delete int tests
-Adding list backups for instance test
-Adding quota for create backup

BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/reddwarf/+spec/consistent-snapshots

Change-Id: I35c2fefcce4b3009e76ba7232c52dabf502a3ac0

deleted_lines: from reddwarf.common import exceptionfrom reddwarf.extensions.mgmt.host.instance import service as hostservicefrom reddwarf.openstack.common import log as logging from reddwarf.openstack.common import rpc member={'action': 'POST'})

added_lines:
Shows information for a specified server.

Resizes the specified server. Specify the resize action in the request body. You can complete the following types of migrations: live migrate with block storage migration; live migrate without block storage migration; non-live migrate, or; resize (this operation). These operations bill you for a snapshot. You can delete the snapshot after you complete the migrate operation.

commit_message:

commit_message:
in dhcp_agent, always use quantum.conf root_helper

Fixes bug #1178003.

For the most part, the dhcp agent uses the root_helper setting from the [AGENT]
section of /etc/quantum/quantum.conf. However, in a couple of spots, the
root_helper setting from the [DEFAULT] section of /etc/quantum/dhcp_agent.ini
was being used.

Change-Id: Id2f3140374a705cf7a0d2a784e4f321cc54f602e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/28630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set MYSQL_HOST parameter to better support multi-node mode.

When deploying openstack with multi-node mode,
mysql needs to be started by listening it's real ip, not localhost.
but devstack always use localhost to recreate databases that will
lead bellow errors.

Fix bug 1177735

Change-Id: I50284f469a998d023a41b4796f1dc775bb52e710
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/27/28527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mysql -u$DATABASE_USER -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -h$MYSQL_HOST -e "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS $db;" mysql -u$DATABASE_USER -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -h$MYSQL_HOST -e "CREATE DATABASE $db CHARACTER SET $charset;"
deleted_lines: mysql -u$DATABASE_USER -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -e "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS $db;" mysql -u$DATABASE_USER -p$DATABASE_PASSWORD -e "CREATE DATABASE $db CHARACTER SET $charset;"

commit_message:
Update the package name of qpid in the fedora platform

The package name of qpid in default yum repository
is qpid-cpp-server, not qpid-cpp-server-daemon.

Fix bug 1177731

Change-Id: I4412029966583f5ef5a5a4cc80e7fdc4771c8eca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/24/28524/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uninstall_package qpid-cpp-server install_package qpid-cpp-server
deleted_lines: if [[ $DISTRO =~ (rhel6) ]]; then uninstall_package qpid-cpp-server else uninstall_package qpid-cpp-server-daemon fi install_package qpid-cpp-server else install_package qpid-cpp-server-daemon

subject: Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-06 17:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/test_db_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e49e38cbd9d8df2281c0bfddfe6e4aaea90b889b', 'message': "Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1
"}]
commit_message:
Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/28329/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We're seeing issues with foreign key support in SQLite 3.6.20 # SQLAlchemy doesn't support it at all with < SQLite 3.6.19 # It works fine in SQLite 3.7. # So return early to skip this test if running SQLite < 3.7 import sqlite3 tup = sqlite3.sqlite_version_info if tup[0] < 3 or (tup[0] == 3 and tup[1] < 7): self.skipTest( 'sqlite version too old for reliable SQLA foreign_keys')

commit_message:
Revoke tokens on user delete (bug 1166670)

Change-Id: Id8a2972c9adb572ef9d2b7f03bcf07a8de5614ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/78/28678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_delete_user_invalidates_token(self): from keystoneclient import exceptions as client_exceptions admin_client = self.get_client(admin=True) client = self.get_client(admin=False) username = uuid.uuid4().hex password = uuid.uuid4().hex user_id = admin_client.users.create( name=username, password=password, email=uuid.uuid4().hex).id token_id = client.tokens.authenticate( username=username, password=password).id # token should be usable before the user is deleted client.tokens.authenticate(token=token_id) admin_client.users.delete(user=user_id) # authenticate with a token should not work after the user is deleted self.assertRaises(client_exceptions.Unauthorized, client.tokens.authenticate, token=token_id)

commit_message:
Create image api does not show all required or optional attributes.

"name" and "metadata" only occurs in the example,
but they are not specified in the "Request parameters" section.
there is no doc to indicate that if them are required or optional.

Fix bug 1158134

Change-Id: Iacf6df91e4633a32a2c6b31b9d3d660299ad800a

subject: refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-07 22:03:48.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/tests/test_config.py', 'marconi/tests/util/__init__.py', 'marconi/tests/storage/base.py', 'HACKING.rst', 'marconi/tests/util/helpers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/8b31b2e9b0c45aafcc55f3be2b59416e46c72d01', 'message': "refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace

It's silly to have to import a package's submodule directly,
since in this case that only introduces another module name
that the developer has to keep track of, just to gain access
to a solitary function. This patch hoists
marconi.tests.util.helpers.expect into marocni.tests.util so
that it can be referenced more naturally by the test author.

Accordingly, the Hacking.rst guide has been updated to allow
this sort of thing (with some discretion).

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: Iad2e4f728aa4826d99bec2c599e2947a87eb5945
"}]
commit_message:
refactor: Hoist helpers.expect into package namespace

It's silly to have to import a package's submodule directly,
since in this case that only introduces another module name
that the developer has to keep track of, just to gain access
to a solitary function. This patch hoists
marconi.tests.util.helpers.expect into marocni.tests.util so
that it can be referenced more naturally by the test author.

Accordingly, the Hacking.rst guide has been updated to allow
this sort of thing (with some discretion).

Implements: blueprint grizzly-debt
Change-Id: Iad2e4f728aa4826d99bec2c599e2947a87eb5945
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/75/28475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def expect(*exc_type): """A context manager to validate raised expections. Can be used as an alternative to testtools.ExpectedException. Notable differences: 1. This context manager accepts child classes of the given type, testing that an "except" statement referencing the given type would indeed catch it when raised by the statement(s) defined inside the context. 2. When the expected exception (or a child thereof) is not raised, this context manager *always* raises an AssertionError, both when a different exception is raised, and when no exception is raised at all. :param *exc_type: Exception type(s) expected to be raised during execution of the "with" context. """
deleted_lines: def expected(*exc_type):

commit_message:
Changes to Nova for Quantum

This patch removes Quantum as an option in network.pp. If using
Quantum, just directly use nova::network::quantum instead. This
patch also enables Nova to be configured to use Quantum security
groups.

Change-Id: I162f1c5153f10150ac4997d31d3b50b702daf013
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/46/28646/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*security_group_api*] # (optional) Enables Nova to use Quantum security groups. # Defaults to 'quantum'. Set to 'nova' if you want to use Nova. # # [*firewall_driver*] # (optional) Turns the Nova firewall off as Quantum implements its own. # Defaults to NoopFirewallDriver. Change to # nova.virt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver # for the Nova default. # $quantum_admin_auth_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0', $security_group_api = 'quantum', $firewall_driver = 'nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver', 'DEFAULT/security_group_api': value => $security_group_api; 'DEFAULT/firewall_driver': value => $firewall_driver; }

commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
(cherry picked from commit 58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/69/28569/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: signing_dir = /tmp/keystone-signing-nova

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 02:41:09.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/installing-rabbitmq.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/installing-mysql.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/samples/nova.conf-yum', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/compute-config-guest-network.xml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/a58e2213e3248e3c85dd5eca2b9219553174da04', 'message': 'Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.

Removed the auth="no" setting from the section of the guide it was in
which was unrelated to messaging and assumed that Qpid would be
colocated with Nova (hence the config file being updated didn't exist
for some users).

Updated the message broker installation section to more thoroughly cover
Qpid installation and set up and added missing rpc_backend directive to
the example nova.conf file for the "yum" version of the book. Also fixed

because the introduction tells the user that the commands within the

Change-Id: I89df0d1050c6871254001e560a45ea6189bbfe18

commit_message:
Bug # 1156429 - Correct placement of auth=no setting for Qpid.

Removed the auth="no" setting from the section of the guide it was in
which was unrelated to messaging and assumed that Qpid would be
colocated with Nova (hence the config file being updated didn't exist
for some users).

Updated the message broker installation section to more thoroughly cover
Qpid installation and set up and added missing rpc_backend directive to
the example nova.conf file for the "yum" version of the book. Also fixed
an errant prompt character in the installing MySQL material (s/$/#/)
because the introduction tells the user that the commands within the
section need to be run as root.

Change-Id: I89df0d1050c6871254001e560a45ea6189bbfe18

commit_message:
Refreshed Oslo Code

    Change to auth_tok to auth_token
    Added dependency on oslo.config package
    Remove reddwarf.openstack.common.cfg

Change-Id: I61af7a54d09f3d1d6b6efe470ea6308be8ace2e7
Fixes: bug #1175757

added_lines: import functoolsimport types_nasty_type_tests = [inspect.ismodule, inspect.isclass, inspect.ismethod, inspect.isfunction, inspect.isgeneratorfunction, inspect.isgenerator, inspect.istraceback, inspect.isframe, inspect.iscode, inspect.isbuiltin, inspect.isroutine, inspect.isabstract] _simple_types = (types.NoneType, int, basestring, bool, float, long) def to_primitive(value, convert_instances=False, convert_datetime=True, level=0, max_depth=3): # handle obvious types first - order of basic types determined by running # full tests on nova project, resulting in the following counts: # 572754 <type 'NoneType'> # 460353 <type 'int'> # 379632 <type 'unicode'> # 274610 <type 'str'> # 199918 <type 'dict'> # 114200 <type 'datetime.datetime'> # 51817 <type 'bool'> # 26164 <type 'list'> # 6491 <type 'float'> # 283 <type 'tuple'> # 19 <type 'long'> if isinstance(value, _simple_types): return value if isinstance(value, datetime.datetime): if convert_datetime: return timeutils.strtime(value) else: return value # value of itertools.count doesn't get caught by nasty_type_tests # and results in infinite loop when list(value) is called. if level > max_depth: recursive = functools.partial(to_primitive, convert_instances=convert_instances, convert_datetime=convert_datetime, level=level, max_depth=max_depth) if isinstance(value, dict): return dict((k, recursive(v)) for k, v in value.iteritems()) elif isinstance(value, (list, tuple)): return [recursive(lv) for lv in value] if convert_datetime and isinstance(value, datetime.datetime): return recursive(dict(value.iteritems()), level=level + 1) elif hasattr(value, '__iter__'): return recursive(list(value)) return recursive(value.__dict__, level=level + 1) else: if any(test(value) for test in _nasty_type_tests): return unicode(value)
deleted_lines: def to_primitive(value, convert_instances=False, level=0): nasty = [inspect.ismodule, inspect.isclass, inspect.ismethod, inspect.isfunction, inspect.isgeneratorfunction, inspect.isgenerator, inspect.istraceback, inspect.isframe, inspect.iscode, inspect.isbuiltin, inspect.isroutine, inspect.isabstract] for test in nasty: if test(value): return unicode(value) # value of itertools.count doesn't get caught by inspects # above and results in infinite loop when list(value) is called. if level > 3: if isinstance(value, (list, tuple)): o = [] for v in value: o.append(to_primitive(v, convert_instances=convert_instances, level=level)) return o elif isinstance(value, dict): o = {} for k, v in value.iteritems(): o[k] = to_primitive(v, convert_instances=convert_instances, level=level) return o elif isinstance(value, datetime.datetime): return to_primitive(dict(value.iteritems()), convert_instances=convert_instances, level=level + 1) elif hasattr(value, '__iter__'): return to_primitive(list(value), convert_instances=convert_instances, level=level) return to_primitive(value.__dict__, convert_instances=convert_instances, level=level + 1) else:

commit_message:
added cell_name to admin api call for server as separate extension

Add an extension to Server API to return the cellName of a server.
This needs to be a different extension than existing server extension,
so that only interested parties can enable this.

Implements: blueprint cellname-servers-api
Change-Id: Ibcac1c5977fec3b03f389fafca264f3c98099cf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/23867/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: key = "%s:cell_name" % Extended_server_attributes.alias server[key] = instance['cell_name']

commit_message:
Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7

commit_message:
Use conditional GET to fetch latest ubuntu image.

This also switches to using curl which some people may not have
installed. However, curl is far superior for this type of download.

Change-Id: I7ac5a84b30eb8daad320c082f976931c41a24669
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/66/27866/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cache_url() { local url=$1 local dest=$2 local tmp=$(mktemp $(dirname $dest)/.download.XXXXXXXX) rcode=$(curl -o $tmp -z $dest -w '%{http_code}' $url) if [ "$rcode" == "200" ] ; then echo "Server copy has changed. Using server version of $url" mv $tmp $dest elif [ "$rcode" == "304" ] ; then echo "Server copy has not changed. Using locally cached $url" rm -f $tmp else echo "Server returned an unexpected response code. [$rcode]" rm -f $tmp return 1 fi } echo "Fetching Base Image" cache_url $SHA256SUMS $IMG_PATH/SHA256SUMS.ubuntu.$DIB_RELEASE.$ARCH cache_url $DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES/$DIB_RELEASE/current/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE $IMG_PATH/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE pushd $IMG_PATH grep "$BASE_IMAGE_FILE" SHA256SUMS.ubuntu.$DIB_RELEASE.$ARCH | sha256sum --check - popd
deleted_lines: # TODO: don't cache -current forever. if [ ! -f $IMG_PATH/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE ] ; then echo "Fetching Base Image" wget $SHA256SUMS -O $IMG_PATH/SHA256SUMS.ubuntu.$DIB_RELEASE.$ARCH wget $DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES/$DIB_RELEASE/current/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE -O $IMG_PATH/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE.tmp pushd $IMG_PATH awk "/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE/ { print \$0 \".tmp\" }" SHA256SUMS.ubuntu.$DIB_RELEASE.$ARCH | sha256sum --check - popd mv $IMG_PATH/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE.tmp $IMG_PATH/$BASE_IMAGE_FILE fi

Replace password to "***" in the debug message

Use regex pattern to replace password to "***" for both env vars and
request body output

Fix bug 1166697

Change-Id: I671ea25cca78b4dea1fbf2e63c89b82912279f2d

deleted_lines: LOG.debug('%s = %s', key, value) LOG.debug(line)

commit_message:
Refactor of puppet-quantum

This commit introduces several changes to the quantum puppet module:

  * Rewrites the README.md file
  * Fixes the example manifest
  * Adds examples/create_network.sh as a quick helper script until
    proper types/providers are made.
  * Removes rootwrap.conf. This should be packaged by the distribution.
  * Removes the qemu.conf file from manifests/init.pp. This is not the
    right place for this file and packaging a full qemu.conf file into
    this module is not a good idea.
  * Renames two variables in params.pp to something more intuitive.
  * Renames auth_password to keystone_password in manifests/server.pp
    as this is the naming scheme used in other modules.
  * Fixes tenant specification in keystone/auth.pp
  * Removes UUIDs specified in agents/l3.pp
  * Adds external bridge creation in agents/l3.pp
  * Adds metadata_ip to agents/l3.pp
  * Adds firewall support in manifests/agents/ovs.pp
  * Lots of formatting and restructuring

Change-Id: Ifc4325f7d472a3fd78f7b379b5095b974874909b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/68/28268/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Changes the OVS plugin/agent

This patch makes the following changes to the OVS plugin/agent:

  * Adds doc heads
  * Adds firewall driver support
  * Allows GRE to be setup without VLANs
  * Renames the plugin package to a more intuitive name
  * General format/code cleanup

Change-Id: I96080171a9b6e252510ce62351db98926f754c31

commit_message:
Remove subscribe on cinder.conf

This is already taken care of with this relationship in the same file:

commit_message:
Run cfn-hup via a cron job.

cfn-hup is supposed to be a daemon, but it doesn't work that way. So run
it via a wrapper in a cron job. Also run this way, we won't have
logging, so make sure os-refresh-config is run via upstart so we get the
output logged.

The wrapper must use a lock to avoid problems that might be caused when
multiple updates overlap.

Change-Id: I8613c45b33091ad6448ecddebe6a1f4337f09d7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/25/28625/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import fcntl import os import random import subprocess import sys import time if len(sys.argv) > 1: max_sleep = int(sys.argv[1]) else: max_sleep = 59 randskew = random.randint(0, max_sleep) time.sleep(randskew) with open('/run/os-refresh-config-cfn-hup.lock', 'a') as lock: fcntl.flock(lock, fcntl.LOCK_EX) lock.seek(0) lock.truncate() lock.write('Lock held by process id %s\n' % os.getpid()) lock.flush() try: subprocess.check_call(['cfn-hup', '--no-daemon']) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: sys.stderr.write("%s\n", e) sys.exit(e.returncode)

commit_message:
Force the inclusion of /usr/local/bin in PATH.

Sudo compiled with the --with-secure-path option enabled (default on
Ubuntu, Fedora and potentially other distros) will cause sudo to ignore
any changes made to the PATH variable in the user's environment (even when
the -E option is used). Also, some distros might not have /usr/local/bin
set in their sudoers secure_path causing the diskimage-builder to fail
when building an image using such distros as host. This patch will force
the inclusion of the /usr/local/bin in the PATH enviroment variable
inside the chroot.

Change-Id: Idb7156d8ff124bfe685cc721337d9bb21f49dc9e
Fixes: bug #1175980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/14/28414/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Force the inclusion of /usr/local/bin in PATH, this is needed for some # distros that does not include /usr/local/bin in the sudoers secure_path. # Note that we're not expanding PATH during argument processing, the \$ # will preserve the PATH syntax until after the sh command runs cmd="PATH=\$PATH:/usr/local/bin ; $@" # -E to preserve http_proxy sudo -E chroot $TMP_MOUNT_PATH sh -c "$cmd"
deleted_lines: # -E to preserve http_proxy sudo -E chroot $TMP_MOUNT_PATH "$@"

commit_message:
Fix /32 subnet creation to work properly

Currently when creates subnet with /32 cidr, allocation pool
and gateway are set incorrect. For /32 cidr, DHCP should be
disabled and gateway should be set None.

Change-Id: Ifbdad9a2187c9cfcc88380e812f384566151d424
Fixes: bug #1177196
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/39/28539/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mask = subnet_cidr.split('/')[1] if mask == '32': subnet_first_ip = subnet_last_ip = netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.first) # add /31 here later, if needed else: subnet_first_ip = netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.first + 1) subnet_last_ip = netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.last - 1) mask = subnet['cidr'].split('/')[1] if mask == '32': pools.append({'start': str(netaddr.IPAddress(net.first)), 'end': str(netaddr.IPAddress(net.first))}) # add /31 here later, if needed else: first_ip = net.first + 1 last_ip = net.last - 1 gw_ip = int(netaddr.IPAddress(subnet['gateway_ip'] or net.last)) # Use the gw_ip to find a point for splitting allocation pools # for this subnet split_ip = min(max(gw_ip, net.first), net.last) if split_ip > first_ip: pools.append({'start': str(netaddr.IPAddress(first_ip)), 'end': str(netaddr.IPAddress(split_ip - 1))}) if split_ip < last_ip: pools.append({'start': str(netaddr.IPAddress(split_ip + 1)), 'end': str(netaddr.IPAddress(last_ip))}) mask = s['cidr'].split('/')[1] if mask == '32': s['gateway_ip'] = None s['enable_dhcp'] = False # add /31 here later, if needed else: if s['gateway_ip'] == attributes.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED: s['gateway_ip'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress(net.first + 1))
deleted_lines: subnet_first_ip = netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.first + 1) subnet_last_ip = netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.last - 1) first_ip = net.first + 1 last_ip = net.last - 1 gw_ip = int(netaddr.IPAddress(subnet['gateway_ip'] or net.last)) # Use the gw_ip to find a point for splitting allocation pools # for this subnet split_ip = min(max(gw_ip, net.first), net.last) if split_ip > first_ip: pools.append({'start': str(netaddr.IPAddress(first_ip)), 'end': str(netaddr.IPAddress(split_ip - 1))}) if split_ip < last_ip: pools.append({'start': str(netaddr.IPAddress(split_ip + 1)), 'end': str(netaddr.IPAddress(last_ip))}) if s['gateway_ip'] is attributes.ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED: s['gateway_ip'] = str(netaddr.IPAddress(net.first + 1))

commit_message:
Session cleanup for db.floating_ip_* methods

Session objects shouldn't be used in public db.api methods
because db.api should be independent of db implementation.

Remove session parameter from:
  floating_ip_create
  floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id

I didn't remove session parameter from floating_ip_count_by_project
because it causes changes in nova.quota. So it will be done in
separated patch.

Cleanup test for floating_ip_count_by_project removed 3rd
parameter (it should be session, but it is not required).

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ifdf9edb17746a8e5b486317c917ea69016a2b99d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/28235/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def floating_ip_create(context, values):def _floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id(context, fixed_ip_id, session=None):def floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id(context, fixed_ip_id): return _floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id(context, fixed_ip_id) @require_context _floating_ips = _floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id(context, fixed_ip['id'])
deleted_lines: def floating_ip_create(context, values, session=None):def floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id(context, fixed_ip_id, session=None): if not session: session = get_session() _floating_ips = floating_ip_get_by_fixed_ip_id(context, fixed_ip['id'])

commit_message:
Remove stack trace logs from fault message

In case of Nova fails to deploy an image, when user run
cli command like "nova show image-name" it will show the
exception class name, the detail message that is thrown from
the exception class, and also the stack trace logs.

End-user does not need to see the stack trace logs, this should be
seen in nova compute log files.

This fix will remove the stack trace logs from fault message.

Fixes bug 1177205

Change-Id: I39323beef69485a1c37e5a46fb448a292d9941e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/28391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Extend mellanox support to disk images.

We need to support mellanox devices in disk images as well as ramdisks.
This adds the requisite element structure to provide that support.

Change-Id: Iaf383f5b32b84fbb69569ef42ec2460ab1b231e5

commit_message:
Remove img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.

Ramdisk-image-create sources both img-functions and ramdisk-functions
causing duplicate functions. To correct this situation this patch
removes the import of img-functions from ramdisk-image-create.
It moves cleanup_dirs and run_d functions from img-functions to
common-functions to allow this.

fixes bug 1175427
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I971d019b0d92b06d9de661663b49c433e823ea42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/20/28320/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function cleanup_dirs () { sudo rm -rf $TMP_BUILD_DIR/built sudo rm -rf $TMP_BUILD_DIR/mnt sudo umount $TMP_BUILD_DIR rm -rf $TMP_BUILD_DIR } # Run a directory of hooks outside the target. function run_d() { check_element check_break before-$1 bash if [ -d ${TMP_HOOKS_PATH}/$1.d ] ; then run-parts ${TMP_HOOKS_PATH}/$1.d fi check_break after-$1 bash }

commit_message:
Ignore errors when ldd'ing static binaries.

When trying to get the library dependencies from a static program
it fails and die.
This scapes the error and continue with the execution.

Change-Id: Id3463f2dd77a182ce4f9d9d28165d35f17806892

commit_message:
Add basic lbaas workflow

Fixes bug 1156828

Change-Id: I080fe1b2642d0bd7bac2bdbbcb737c9753c934fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/88/27788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="lbaas"> <title>Load-Balancer-as-a-Service</title> <note><para>The Load-Balancer-as-a-Service API is an experimental API meant to give early adopters and vendors a chance to build implementations aganist. The reference implementation should probably not be run in production environments.</para></note> <section xml:id="lbaas_workflow"> <title>Common Load-Balancer-as-a-Service Workflow</title> <para>Create a loadbalancer pool:</para> <screen><computeroutput> quantum lb-pool-create --lb-method ROUND_ROBIN --name mypool --protocol HTTP --subnet-id <subnet-uuid></computeroutput></screen> <para>Associate two webservers with pool:</para> <screen><computeroutput> quantum lb-member-create --address <webserver one IP> --protocol-port 80 mypool quantum lb-member-create --address <webserver two IP> --protocol-port 80 mypool</computeroutput></screen> <para>Create a health monitor which checks to make sure our instances are still running on the specified protocol-port:</para> <screen><computeroutput> quantum lb-healthmonitor-create --delay 3 --type HTTP --max-retries 3 --timeout 3</computeroutput></screen> <para>Associate healthmonitor with pool:</para> <screen><computeroutput> quantum lb-healthmonitor-associate <healthmonitor-uuid> mypool</computeroutput></screen> <para>Create a Virtual IP Address (VIP) that when accessed the loadbalancer will direct the requests to one of the pool members:</para> <screen><computeroutput> quantum lb-vip-create --name myvip --protocol-port 80 --protocol HTTP --subnet-id <subnet-uuid> mypool</computeroutput></screen> </section> </section>

subject: Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 15:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/api-paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce', 'message': 'Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
'}]
commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/28568/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # signing_dir is configurable, but the default behavior of the authtoken # middleware should be sufficient. It will create a temporary directory # in the home directory for the user the nova process is running as. #signing_dir = /var/lib/nova/keystone-signing
deleted_lines: signing_dir = /tmp/keystone-signing-nova

commit_message:
Remove insecure default for signing_dir option.

The sample api-paste.ini file included an insecure value for the
signing_dir option for the keystone authtoken middleware.  Comment out
the option so that we just rely on the default behavior by default.

Fix bug 1174608.

Conflicts:
	etc/nova/api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I6189788953d789c34456bbe150b8ed6ce6f68403
(cherry picked from commit 58d6879b1caaa750c39c8e452a0634c24ffef2ce)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/28570/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # signing_dir is configurable, but the default behavior of the authtoken # middleware should be sufficient. It will create a temporary directory # in the home directory for the user the nova process is running as. #signing_dir = /var/lib/nova/keystone-signing
deleted_lines: signing_dir = /tmp/keystone-signing-nova

subject: Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 19:03:30.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-common.conf', 'tools/patch_tox_venv.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9581e5b71b6c7807a8897ddd0a4dc3556462d96b', 'message': " Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7
"}]
commit_message:
Copy the RHEL6 eventlet workaround from Oslo

Tests in oslo-incubator now need the horrendous hack to workaround an
issue with eventlet on RHEL6. We've moved the patch_tox_venv tool
and redhat-eventlet.patch into oslo-incubator, so add them to
openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I1acfec282b64d7582144b155119bedb1741db2f7

commit_message:
Fix test_mismatched_X test data deletion check

The assertion checking if data for an image is deleted correctly will
always pass. This is because it was using only the name of the file instead of
the absolute path.

Fixes bug 1177818

Change-Id: I8b99a4156ce72cb278c9c173a27253ab191dd451

commit_message:
Avoid extra queries when retrieving routers

fixes bug 1160333

Instead of making N additional sql requests,
use relationship and joined query.

Change-Id: I8f650691916a252bf2a525343bfa0521ff6fbe43

commit_message:
Enable using multiple API versions for Identity Service.

Introduces a mechanism for switching between API versions,
and implements it in a proof-of-concept fashion for the
Keystone v3 API. Converts the existing Users and Projects
API methods to use it.

This changed some method signatures, and therefore altered
a number of views and tests. However, all code related to
the version cahnges is contained in the api.keystone module.
This seems like a sane process going forwards.

Future TODOs are marked in the code, including auto-detection
of API versions and better endpoint URL construction.

Partially implements blueprint api-capability-detection

Change-Id: Ied04200fe6c257aac2241d36628965a3bb6658b9

commit_message:
Fix ability to add custom volume_backend_name

This patch fixes the ability to set the volume_backend_name
for each driver.   The original bug was filed against LeftHand
and 3PAR, but several drivers exhibited a fixed backend name.

Fixes: bug #1175222
       bug #1172286

Change-Id: I4197f99bebd6ca8e4969795ae6edb537bc066c90
(cherry picked from commit 54a2ee48a4dc31cbf116b1e9d5add37efe66bc20)

deleted_lines: 'volume_backend_name': 'Scality_SOFS',

commit_message:
Securely create signing_dir (bug 1174608)

Also verifies the security of an existing signing_dir.

Change-Id: I0685b4274a94ad3974a2b2a7ab3f45830d3934bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/72/28572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os.path.exists(self.signing_dirname): if not os.access(self.signing_dirname, os.W_OK): raise ConfigurationError( 'unable to access signing_dir %s' % self.signing_dirname) if os.stat(self.signing_dirname).st_uid != os.getuid(): self.LOG.warning( 'signing_dir is not owned by %s' % os.getlogin()) current_mode = stat.S_IMODE(os.stat(self.signing_dirname).st_mode) if current_mode != stat.S_IRWXU: self.LOG.warning( 'signing_dir mode is %s instead of %s' % (oct(current_mode), oct(stat.S_IRWXU))) else: os.makedirs(self.signing_dirname, stat.S_IRWXU)
deleted_lines: if (os.path.exists(self.signing_dirname) and not os.access(self.signing_dirname, os.W_OK)): raise ConfigurationError("unable to access signing dir %s" % self.signing_dirname) if not os.path.exists(self.signing_dirname): os.makedirs(self.signing_dirname) #will throw IOError if it cannot change permissions os.chmod(self.signing_dirname, stat.S_IRWXU)

commit_message:
Add db client packages to dev env setup doc.

Dev env setup doc hasn't been updated in a while and
needed the addition of the mysql and psql packages.

Tested this on a clean install and it looks like
the addition of these two pkgs should get us up to
date.

Change-Id: I66011478064bd8fb85bfaf56e8b14232226e0efc

commit_message:
Rename nova.compute.instance_types to flavors

First step in removing references to instance_types. Rename instnace_types.py
and update references to it. We currently use instance_type and flavor as
synonyms, to reduce confusion we are picking one. We are going with our own
terminology, flavors.

renamed:    nova/compute/instance_types.py -> nova/compute/flavors.py

Partially implements bp flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I9dc04cf311aa8813be4f5329f23729d2c43cae6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/56/28456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.compute import flavors instance_type = flavors.extract_instance_type(instance)
deleted_lines: from nova.compute import instance_types instance_type = instance_types.extract_instance_type(instance)

commit_message:
Enable swift

- Install swift as part of reddwarf-integration
- Add a swiftclient dependency to install the latest swiftclient as
  part of the guest image.

Fixes bug: 1171595

Change-Id: I9010bfb87ff5c3b113887ab63d09d6cd285e9975

commit_message:
Fix GroupSet assignment to use resource id instead of name

This allows the security groups to be passed to Quantum in the
expected format.

Change-Id: I7925bfdb71a076b4a2ecdeee396abf42d111ef8c
Fixes: bug #1164913

commit_message:
Import recent rootwrap features in local rootwrap

Import features developed in oslo-rootwrap during the Grizzly cycle (and
recently in havana) into quantum-rootwrap. This is the first step toward
using the common oslo-rootwrap into Quantum: the goal being to make both
implementations converge, we should avoid making local changes (and push
any required change into oslo-rootwrap instead from now on).

New features include:
- Optional logging (use_syslog)
- Searching for executables in a specified binary path (exec_dirs)
- New path-based PathFilter

Those features required a refactoring in the way executables are matched
and in configuration loading.

Implements bp quantum-rootwrap-new-features

Change-Id: Ia6a2e91c297ade471448dae0964adfd001a46086

self.assertRaises(wrapper.FilterMatchNotExecutable, wrapper.match_filter, self.filters, valid_but_missing) self.assertRaises(wrapper.NoFilterMatched, wrapper.match_filter, self.filters, invalid) if not os.path.exists("/proc/%d" % os.getpid()): self.skipTest("Test requires /proc filesystem (procfs)") p = subprocess.Popen(["cat"], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.STDOUT) try: f = filters.KillFilter("root", "/bin/cat", "-9", "-HUP") f2 = filters.KillFilter("root", "/usr/bin/cat", "-9", "-HUP") usercmd = ['kill', '-ALRM', p.pid] # Incorrect signal should fail self.assertFalse(f.match(usercmd) or f2.match(usercmd)) usercmd = ['kill', p.pid] # Providing no signal should fail self.assertFalse(f.match(usercmd) or f2.match(usercmd)) # Providing matching signal should be allowed usercmd = ['kill', '-9', p.pid] self.assertTrue(f.match(usercmd) or f2.match(usercmd)) f = filters.KillFilter("root", "/bin/cat") f2 = commit_message:
Explicitely register options to fix intermittent failure

Using parallel tests, stackServiceTest sometimes fail with a
NoSuchOptError. Adding a register_engine_opts call seems to fix it.

Change-Id: I2bc6e7ab8d2e2cb20d1f3e7d0d93d75bdb631af3

commit_message:
Simplified stress tests.

Change-Id: I32f751ab8222f4ccfedc3bdd6c12982dc2cde9bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/50/27950/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Quanta Research Cambridge OpenStack Stress Test System ====================================================== Nova is a distributed, asynchronous system that is prone to race condition bugs. These bugs will not be easily found during functional testing but will be encountered by users in large deployments in a way that is hard to debug. The stress test tries to cause these bugs to happen in a more controlled environment. Environment ------------ This particular framework assumes your working Nova cluster understands Nova API 2.0. The stress tests can read the logs from the cluster. To enable this you have to provide the hostname to call 'nova-manage' and the private key and user name for ssh to the cluster in the [stress] section of tempest.conf. You also need to provide the location of the log files: target_logfiles = "regexp to all log files to be checked for errors" target_private_key_path = "private ssh key for controller and log file nodes" target_ssh_user = "username for controller and log file nodes" target_controller = "hostname or ip of controller node (for nova-manage) Running the sample test ----------------------- To test your installation, do the following (from the tempest directory): python new_stress/tests/test_create_destroy.py This sample test tries to create a few VMs and kill a few VMs. Additional Tools ---------------- Sometimes the tests don't finish, or there are failures. In these cases, you may want to clean out the nova cluster. We have provided some scripts to do this in the ``tools`` subdirectory. You can use the following script to destroy any keypairs, floating ips, and servers: new_stress/tools/cleanup.py

commit_message:
Add affinity availability zone scheduler filter

Create an new filter to schedule the instance on a same/different availability
zone of a set of instances. And add some tests for the filter.

Since get instance availability zone code is need by many modules, so move it
into utils module nova.avalability_zones. And add some tests for the new
method.

Implemented bp: different-availability-zone-filter

Change-Id: Icee1db0db383a45bfec95209965725e522e90679
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/22770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import availability_zones as az class BaseAvailabilityZoneFilter(AffinityFilter): def _get_instance_availability_zones(self, context, instance_uuids): instances = self.compute_api.get_all(context, {'uuid': instance_uuids, 'deleted': False}) return set([az.get_instance_availability_zone(context, inst) for inst in instances]) def _get_host_availability_zone(self, context, host): elevated = context.elevated() return az.get_host_availability_zone(elevated, host) class SameAvailabilityZoneFilter(BaseAvailabilityZoneFilter): """Schedule the instance on a same availability zone of a set of instances. """ def host_passes(self, host_state, filter_properties): context = filter_properties['context'] scheduler_hints = filter_properties.get('scheduler_hints') or {} affinity_uuids = scheduler_hints.get('same_availability_zone', []) if isinstance(affinity_uuids, basestring): affinity_uuids = [affinity_uuids] if affinity_uuids: azs = self._get_instance_availability_zones(context, affinity_uuids) my_az = self._get_host_availability_zone(context, host_state.host) return my_az in azs return True class DifferentAvailabilityZoneFilter(BaseAvailabilityZoneFilter): """Schedule the instance on a different availability zone of a set of instances. """ def host_passes(self, host_state, filter_properties): context = filter_properties['context'] scheduler_hints = filter_properties.get('scheduler_hints') or {} affinity_uuids = scheduler_hints.get('different_availability_zone', []) if isinstance(affinity_uuids, basestring): affinity_uuids = [affinity_uuids] if affinity_uuids: azs = self._get_instance_availability_zones(context, affinity_uuids) my_az = self._get_host_availability_zone(context, host_state.host) return my_az not in azs return True

commit_message:
Add an ability to add/update/delete individual metadata key for volume

- implemented corresponding methods in volume.cinder.API
- added API controller for volume metadata

Fixes bug 1095271

commit_message:
Skip more tests that require Cinder backups

Most of the unit tests that require the backups feature in
python-cinderclient have been made optional, but a couple remained. This
patch makes those also conditional on the feature being available.

Change-Id: I8c954e7d7aa4b516b302140bfe5e66a7066717ed

on the in-tree templates has been removed, we can remove these

commit_message:
tests : convert test_template_format to test-local templates

test_template_format is different from all other tests, in that
we don't want to use the most minimal template possible, we
actually want to test conversion works with maximal/non-trivial
templates, so copy the two templates used by this test into a
local tests/templates directory, with a README caution that
in general inline-minimal templates are preferred.

Change-Id: Ib5421545103728385992625884f86f2667ee2465

added_lines: from heat.tests.utils import parse_stack nokey_template = ''' { "AWSTemplateFormatVersion" : "2010-09-09", "Description" : "NoKey Test", "Parameters" : {}, "Resources" : { "WebServer": { "Type": "AWS::EC2::Instance", "Properties": { "ImageId" : "foo", "InstanceType" : "m1.large", "UserData" : "some data" } } } } ''' t = template_format.parse(nokey_template) stack = parse_stack(t, stack_name=stack_name, stack_id=uuidutils.generate_uuid())

subject: Expanding the case of InstanceNotFound exception in get-vnc-console.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-02 20:40:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1beb424a647bf018f0e9ba6f962bb9e5986ab8a8', 'message': "Expanding the case of InstanceNotFound exception in get-vnc-console.

Up until now, asking for vnc console of an instance in ERROR status
would lead to InstanceNotReady exception which gets the driver's
instance name as a parameter, however, KeyError would be thrown
because this name is None. This case now will be part of the
InstanceNotFound exception.

commit_message:
Expanding the case of InstanceNotFound exception in get-vnc-console.

Up until now, asking for vnc console of an instance in ERROR status
would lead to InstanceNotReady exception which gets the driver's
instance name as a parameter, however, KeyError would be thrown
because this name is None. This case now will be part of the
InstanceNotFound exception.

Fixes bug 1175776

Change-Id: Id08707e6700fa684ad90af5b792e1397e2047203

subject: Avoid using nosetests --tests config option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-05-08 08:40:47.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/4e168c33c3364e2868a01d19858600666d36e1e4', 'message': "Avoid using nosetests --tests config option

Previously, it was possible to do:

  $> tox -- glance.tests.foo glance.tests.bar

but since we started using tests=glance/tests in setup.cfg[1] you must
now do this:

  $> tox -- --tests glance.tests.foo,glance.tests.bar

because positional args are appended to the value of --tests in the
config file, so you must override it with --tests on the command line.

Use nose's runmodule() API which allows us to set defaultTest to
glance/tests - this acts as a default value where no positional args
are supplied and restores the original behaviour.

[1]- to avoid having nose load code outside glance/tests and fail
because the _() builtin isn't installed

Change-Id: I6c701b09bf02d22c9dfac4a27ebe15c8d5ab631c
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid using nosetests --tests config option

Previously, it was possible to do:

  $> tox -- glance.tests.foo glance.tests.bar

but since we started using tests=glance/tests in setup.cfg[1] you must
now do this:

  $> tox -- --tests glance.tests.foo,glance.tests.bar

because positional args are appended to the value of --tests in the
config file, so you must override it with --tests on the command line.

Use nose's runmodule() API which allows us to set defaultTest to
glance/tests - this acts as a default value where no positional args
are supplied and restores the original behaviour.

[1]- to avoid having nose load code outside glance/tests and fail
because the _() builtin isn't installed

Change-Id: I6c701b09bf02d22c9dfac4a27ebe15c8d5ab631c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/13/28513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = python -c 'import nose; nose.runmodule("glance/tests")' {posargs}
deleted_lines: commands = nosetests {posargs}

commit_message:
Use latest boto to address bugs in distro version.

Ubuntu's boto is fairly old, and affected by http://pad.lv/1177576. This
prevents cloud-init from working with OpenStack's ec2 metadata server
properly.

Change-Id: I110af27d7da520a53d55db3e04dc3382e7e17b38

commit_message:
Add element to remove serial console.

Upstream cloud images likely have console=ttyS0 embedded in the kernel
commandline portion of the GRUB config. This makes local, direct testing
of the images substantially more difficult because upstart is writing
its output to a console that isn't being monitored.
This element simply removes console=ttyS0 from the grub configuration.

Change-Id: I07429bb504b467634071cc31ef184af730bbb5d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/39/28439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh sed -i -e 's/ console=ttyS0//' /etc/default/grub sed -i -e 's/ console=ttyS0//' /boot/grub/grub.cfg

commit_message:
Target ec2-user workaround to Ubuntu 12.10.

Ubuntu 13.04 has been confirmed to work properly, so only Ubuntu 12.10
is affected by the bug (http://pad.lv/1100920). Thus, we can narrow the
scope of the workaround to just "Ubuntu quantal".

Change-Id: Ib42e2bce2f4d0d2cfd6bdeb70cfa4162c2cd6433

commit_message:
Add libz-dev to os-svc-install to fix raring.

Before Ubuntu 13.04 libz-dev was pulled in as a dependency of the other
libraries mentioned here, but 13.04 changed the graph. Lxml and possibly
other modules link against libz during the pip install phase.

Change-Id: I201f7dd2fc40d36e5e0b193d51cfee200f946d17

commit_message:
Remove tripleo PPA from base element.

The PPA would have to be updated for each release we want to build for,
including raring. The PPA also gives the tripleo team root on every
built image, something we don't necessarily want.

A shallow review of the packages in the PPA and known elements shows
only one dependency in the tripleo-image-elements heat-cfntools element.

Change-Id: Ic514f929eba26014dd3a0d76d5bb3b8e9e0caf3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/34/28434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Example alternate fix for atomic transactions

This patch shows an alternate way of fixing the atomic
identity modifications to allow drivers that are capable
of transactions to implement them as needed.

Basically, this required pulling code calls out of the
controller layer and into the underlying drivers. The
pattern to follow to allow transactional drivers to issue
appropriate session handling is to ensure each main
"entry point" on the controller only issues calls to the
drivers that return information (for instance, to check
if something exists when trying to delete or add) and
only a single driver call that modifies data. Let the drivers
themselves call other driver methods if need be, ensuring
that outer transactions can be contained, if the driver
supports it.

This patch just shows the create_user() example. Clearly
each controller method would need to be examined to ensure
only a single data-modifying call is made in any of the
controller methods.

Partially fixes lp 1130676

Change-Id: I8631a99c5e6936d9902f28f3c38e593d245dcbd5
